Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Go. Get the door.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here we are.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Go. Push!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh god.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Push!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, turn it around.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really shove it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You'll break it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Shove it through! Break it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You shove it. Shove it back! Here we go. Don't break the branches, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I got a splinter.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, suck it up. We all have problems. Hey, everybody, look what we have! [laughs] Nice, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I've got it leveraged. Push. Straight up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: On three. Ready? Big, one, two, three.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: One, two, three. [they push the tree up and it breaks through a ceiling tile.]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Merry Christmas!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did it work?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [holds up the piece of tree he just cut off with a paper cutter] Well, sort of. Why did you get it so big?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A, that's what she said, and B, I wanted it to be impressive. The biggest day of the year deserves the biggest tree of the year.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: But what are we going to do with this hacked off part?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, that is a perfectly good mini-tree, Kevin. And we are going to sell that to charity. That's what Christmas is all about.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So this year, for the first time ever, I got Pam in Secret Santa. And I got her this teapot, which I know she really wants, so she can make tea at her desk. But I'm also going to stuff it with some inside jokes. Like, this is my high school yearbook photo. She saw it at the party, and it really makes her laugh. Not sure why. What else .. ooh. This is a hot sauce packet. She put this on a hot dog a couple years ago because she thought it was ketchup. And it was really funny, so I kept the other two. [holds up a miniature pencil] This would take a little too long to explain, so I won't. And this is the card. Because Christmas is the time to tell people how you feel.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Is there anything we're missing? Phyllis, you got the lights?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yes, I got those cute little ones. [Angela looks at her disapprovingly] Do you think I should have gotten the big ones?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: We'll see.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Angela drafted me into the party planning committee. Her memo said that we need to prepare for every possible disaster. Which to me seems excessive.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [comes into the conference room in a Santa hat and beard] Merry Christmas! Ho, ho, ho, [points to Ryan] pimp. I'm kidding. What do we got, what do we got? How many plates are we getting?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Fifty.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Double it. Double everything. Double ice cream. Double napkins. Double it. On me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It was a tough year. I had to fire somebody this year. This party has to really rock. Check it out. Christmas bonus. 3,000 G's. I got this for helping save the company money. So I guess some good came out of firing Devon after all. Maybe I should call him and tell him that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want people to cut loose. I want people making out in closets. I want people hanging from the ceilings, lamp shades on the heads. I want it to be a Playboy Mansion party. And also, I want you to spread the word that I will have my digital camera. And I'll be taking pictures all along the way. And the best and craziest thing that happens will be on the cover of the newsletter. Incentive.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You do realize that we can't serve liquor at the party.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I know. Damn it. Stupid corporate wet blankets. Like booze ever killed anybody.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin & Oscar
Quote.Text: One, two, three. [they lift and start to move a desk]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You guys should use a hand truck.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Do we have one?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [having trouble with a plastic tablecloth as Pam stands idly by] Will you help me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No! No way! It... no.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Come on, Mike, let me borrow the hat for just a couple of hours.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You wanna be Santa?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Have you ever seen Santa?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, I've seen Santa.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Who cares?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I'm sorry. It just doesn't work.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, I would like to be the elf.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That makes sense because he has elfish features.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [now wearing an elf hat and ears] Okay, everybody listen up! It is time to get your presents, wrap them, and place them under the tree like so. If you do not get your present wrapped and under the tree within the next five minutes you will be disqualified from Secret Santa. All right? No exceptions except Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I got Angela. She is into these posters of babies dressed as adults. I got her one of those. I felt kind of weird buying that.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I got Creed. And to tell you the truth, I don't know anything about Creed. I know his name's Creed. I know he works right over there. I think he's Irish and I .. I got him this shamrock keychain.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I got myself for Secret Santa. I was supposed to tell somebody, but I didn't [smiles happily].

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You get something good this year?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think I did a pretty good job.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah? Who did you have?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I can't tell you cause it's a secret.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think I got something pretty nice for my guy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I spent a lot of dough. Lot of dough. Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, there's a $20 limit, right? So .. ?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. I wanted this party to be really special so I sorta went above and beyond.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's great. Well don't tell me who it is, cause I can ..

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It was Ryan. Yeah. I have Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Gather round. Secret Santa, let's go. Let's go. Come on. Stanley, no, I'm going to handle the cord. Okay, safety reasons.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I know how to plug something in.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I want to do it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, let's count it down, like Rockefeller Center. Ready?

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Three, two, one. [very dim lights come on the tree]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not great.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think the tree looks nice.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, I could get some flares from my car.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no. Shake it off, everybody. Just, let's do Secret Santa.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Presents are the best way to show someone how much you care. It's like this tangible thing that you can point to and say, "Hey, man, I love you this many dollars worth."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: First present, Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [rips off the wrapping] Shower radio. Neat.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, good, that was from me.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Thanks, Kelly. You know I was gonna get one of ..

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. Okay. That's enough. Let's keep it moving on. Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, cool. [opens his plastic bag]

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: That's from me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Great. Where did you get it?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I don't know. It was so long ago.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He obviously forgot to get me something, and then he went in his closet and dug out this little number [holds up way-too-short sleeves] and then threw it in a bag.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Yep. That's exactly what happened.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [opens up her present] Oh, my god! Thank you very much, Santa, whoever you are. It's awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There's a little more to it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All right, next. Ryan. [tosses present]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, don't!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [unwraps present] Whoa, a video iPod.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whoa. Wow. Jeez. Somebody really got carried away with the spirit of Christmas. That was me, I got a little carried away.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Wasn't there a $20 limit on the gift? This is 400 bucks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You don't know that.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, you left the price tag on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I did?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What? Oh, shoot. Wow. Okay, well, who cares? It doesn't matter what I spent. What matters is that Christmas is fun, right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh hey, for me. What is in here? [opens a handmade oven mitt] Oh, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I knitted it for you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: An oven mitt? Okay. [walks out]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So Phyllis is basically saying, "Hey Michael, I know you did a lot to help the office this year but I only care about you a homemade oven mitt's worth." I gave Ryan an iPod.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Should we just keep opening up the presents?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We don't do anything until Michael gives us further instructions.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I got it! We are going to turn Secret Santa into Yankee Swap.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What is Yankee Swap?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: One person chooses a gift. The next person can either choose a gift or steal that person's gift. If your gift gets stolen, then you can steal somebody else's gift or choose a new gift.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I thought that was called Nasty Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, we call it White Elephant.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I call it fun!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why are we doing this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because it's better. Because it's more special.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It sounds mean.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shut it. No, it's not. Okay, just give it a shot.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Michael should have asked the party planning committee first. He's not supposed to just spring things on us out of nowhere. [starts to cry]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, Meredith is up first. Here's the deal. You can either pick a new gift or you can steal somebody else's gift that they've already gotten, like the oven mitt.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I'll take the teapot.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, shouldn't we ... I bought that specifically for Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yankee Swap! That's what makes it fun. Pam, you can steal the oven mitt now.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'll take the iPod.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: And I have to give it to her? I don't have a choice?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, now you can steal the oven mitt, the old shirt or the shower radio or pick a new gift.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [after Ryan opens a new gift - a nameplate saying 'Kelly'] That was meant for Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, I figured.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think this is going great.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [unwrapping the poster] Yikes.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, it's for Angela, so ..

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: That's like, the creepiest thing that I've ever seen.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Angela, you're up.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'll take the poster. Some people like these.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I will steal the iPod.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everyone wants the iPod. It's a huge hit. It is almost a Christmas miracle.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, well, Oscar, you little gourmand, you have the next turn.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'll take the ... teapot.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Damn it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, moving along. Meredith, let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I really want the iPod.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's already been stolen this round. Pick something else.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [holding oven mitt] I hope nobody takes this baby, cause this is great. Wow, look at that fine craftsmanship. Somebody really put a lot of work into that. It's beautiful.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I'll take the oven mitt.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sucker! See, I wanted somebody to take it. Boom! Reverse psychology.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Reverse psychology is an awesome tool. I don't know if you guys know about it, but basically you make someone think the opposite of what you believe and that tricks them into doing something stupid. Works like a charm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [opens present] "In addition to these paintball pellets, your gift includes two paintball lessons with Dwight Schrute."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You and me, Michael. Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who wants to take paintball lessons? How is that better than an iPod?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I never said it was better than an iPod.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael keeps bragging about his iPod, but you know what? Two paintball lessons with someone as experienced as I am is worth easily, like, 2 grand.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [shooting paintball gun at target] Take that, Saddam!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Last gift. Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I want the foot bath.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That's the thing I bought myself. I'm really psyched to use it. [pauses] Maybe I should have taken the iPod. Oh, shoot.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam, steal something or pick the final gift.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I want the iPod.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Damn it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure you don't want the teapot?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, I mean, it's an iPod. But ..

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sorry, I ..

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. No. Definitely. It's ..

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Okay, well, I guess I will take that book of short stories.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes! There you go. I want the teapot. Gracias.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Got to be kidding me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yankee Swap is like Machiavelli meets ... Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [after Phyllis leaves suddenly] What is she so upset about?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe because you hated her present so much.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on! I think that Yankee Swap was a big hit! I think it's a success and I'm the one who ended up with Dwight's stupid paintball pellets.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, but, Michael, the point is that we all bought gifts for specific people.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: And you should have just bought a $20 gift like everyone else.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I didn't. I got a big bonus because I fired Devon, and I used the money to buy something awesome. Sue me!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You got a bonus check?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How much?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It wasn't. It wasn't that much. It was $3,000.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: All right, I'm done now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Unbelievable. I do the nicest thing that anyone has ever done for these people and they freak out. Well, happy birthday, Jesus. Sorry your party's so lame.

Quote.Speaker: Liquor Store Clerk
Quote.Text: It comes to $166.41.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, now, you're the expert. Is this enough to get 20 people plastered?

Quote.Speaker: Liquor Store Clerk
Quote.Text: Fifteen bottles of vodka? Yeah, that should do it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cool, cool. Box it up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I bought this teapot for Pam, and I know she really wants it. So, can I trade you for it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No trades.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Come on, it's a shamrock keychain. Good luck.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: "A real man makes his own luck." Billy Zane. Titanic.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Look, it has sentimental value, Dwight. Can I buy it from you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. I want it. I'm going to use it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You don't even drink tea.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: True. But I get sinus infections, and sinus infections can be cured by making your tea from green tea leaf stems ..

Quote.Speaker: JIm
Quote.Text: Okay ..

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: .. and pouring it directly into your nose, like so. [demonstrates]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: To think that my gift for Pam will be used for that, it's a little too much to handle.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: This is awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know. It's totally going to change the way I work out.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Yeah, I was gonna get you one of these for Christmas, and now I don't have to. I'm gonna save a ton of money.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So what are you going to get me instead?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I don't know. Probably like, a sweater or something.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh-oh. Looks like Santa was a little naughty.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What is that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is Christmas spirit, as in spirits, booze.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: We can drink?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: We're really not supposed to serve alcohol.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Zip it, Toby! Just .. I mean, it's a party. Come on. If I can't throw a good party for my employees, then I am a terrible boss. Who wants a drink?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Me. Please.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Go, here we go!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: The deal is that this is my last hurrah, cause I made a New Year's resolution that I'm not going to drink anymore. During the week.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hi guys.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Does everybody know my boyfriend, Bob Vance?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Kevin Malone.

Quote.Speaker: Bob Vance
Quote.Text: Bob Vance, Vance Refrigeration.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Stanley Hudson.

Quote.Speaker: Bob Vance
Quote.Text: Bob Vance, Vance Refrigeration.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Ryan Howard.

Quote.Speaker: Bob Vance
Quote.Text: Bob Vance, Vance Refrigeration.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What line of work you in, Bob?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I think after I lost Culpepper and T.O it was over, man.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, I need McMahon, Deion Branch to have big games or else I'm done.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: It's possible. I can't believe you traded Shaun Alexander, man.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I had to. I needed defense.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Come on! Shaun Alexander? He's the best back in the league.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's defense.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Oh, no. That is not worth it.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It is worth it.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Never.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Are you kidding? You wait.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Anybody making out in here? [checks hallway] Not yet, give it time. Oh, hey, Ebenezer, boink. [takes picture of Jim] Okay, how's it going in here? [takes picture of Meredith and Kevin]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: We're running low on cups. Do you want me to just run out and get some?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: There should be some ..

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no. We'll find some, don't leave the party.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis, Meredith, Michael, Kevin
Quote.Text: One, two, three. [do a shot]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kudos to Ryan, king of the party committee.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh, no.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I really did not do anything.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, no, no. No false modesty, my friend.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know, you don't have to answer calls during a party. Just thought you should know.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughs] No, I was just checking out my present. [holds up teapot]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But ..

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I traded with Dwight. Just, I figured, you know, you went to a lot of trouble and it means a lot. And also, Roy got me an iPod or was going to get me an iPod, so ..

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, either way. This is an amazing gift because it comes with bonus gifts. Look inside.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [opens teapot] Oh my god! The yearbook picture!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I think I made the right choice.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, my God! It's incredible. [Jim reaches and steals his card back before she can notice it] Is this the Boggle timer?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I didn't think you were going to get that one. I really didn't.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is so awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not bad. And if it couldn't go to Ryan, you are the guy I'd want it to go to.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: [grabbing Michael around the neck] Merry Christmas, asswipe!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No way. Oh, you're kidding me. Packer! Yes! Todd Packer, ladies and gentlemen!

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: [rapping] What's up my nerds. Check it out. [points at the mistletoe stuck down his pants]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, no, no. Oh look at that. Icing on the cake.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Pacman need a drinky.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, let's fix you up. Who wants to fix up .. Toby. Toby's gonna fix you up.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [listening to music through headphones] Yeahhh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Darryl. There you go. [hands him the Santa hat] You earned it.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That's okay, Mike.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no. I really, really want you to have it.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: All right. Thanks, man.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Merry Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [looking at Xeroxed butt pictures] Whose butt is that?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Mine.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh, how did I not guess that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [coming out of his office] Lampshade on head! It's happening!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [as Jim decorates a passed out Todd Packer] Oh, no.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, hello there. [Kelly leans up and kisses him] But what are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You shouldn't do things like that. The man is supposed to do that.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Thanks for the party, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Bob Vance
Quote.Text: Oh, hey. Listen up. We're going to Poor Richard's. Who's in?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm in.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael? Poor Richard's?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, that sounds good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Christmas is awesome. First of all, you get to spend time with people you love. Secondly, you can get drunk and no one can say anything. Third, you give presents. What's better than giving presents? And fourth, getting presents. So, four things. Not bad for one day. It's really the greatest day of all time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Meredith. Heading over to Poor Richard's?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cool, cool, cool. Do you need a ride? [Meredith drops her top. Michael takes a picture] All right, let's head out. Sounds good. Do you have a coat?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Towards me.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Towards me. That's good, towards me. Towards me. Towards me, towards me. Okay, I'm good. I'm good, I'm good.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Okay, okay. [gasping]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Creed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Remember on that animated special when they taught the uh, the monster to put the star on top? That's Dwight. Dwight's the monster that we taught to put the star on top of the tree. You take his teeth out, and he could put the star on top of the tree.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do you want me to help you with that?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Phyllis and Angela and Meredith are helpers. I guess Angela's kind of... Angela's little. Phyllis and Meredith are not little. Pam is sort of a medium helper.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. Christmas lights? Good. Tinsel? Good. Star? Good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight is... Dwight looks like Spock to me. He always wears the ears, and I always give him grief about looking like Spock, and he hates it because he has a different pair of ears that he wears to be Spock, for some reason.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Question, Pam. Is Roy coming to the party?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, well, you didn't tell me that. Now, he will not be allowed in unless we register him on this list.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you kidding?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do I look like I'm kidding? [Pam shakes her head 'no'] Phyllis, stag, I assume.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm bringing someone.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I invited someone to the party. Bob Vance. He works at Vance Refrigeration next door. That's how we met. [whispers] He's my boyfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Everyone, please remain calm until we receive further instructions.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Just let us open up the presents, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Absolutely... not.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What separates humans from jungle beasts? The fact that we have rules. When humans give each other gifts, they do it properly and orderly. When bears give each other gifts they just rip open a fox carcass and present it to their mate. I prefer the human way.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Man, I really wanted that. I really wanted the shower radio, too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, thank God you didn't steal my oven mitt. And Oscar, you little gourmand, your turn.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'll take the tea pot.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Damn it.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: So, I guess, you really didn't want the shower radio that bad.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No, I just like tea.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I don't know why Oscar didn't like the gift. I know he wanted a shower radio. I mean, I totally remember him telling me that he wanted one.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Kelly had me last year, too, and she gave me the same exact thing. I only have one shower.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oscar, paint ball pellets.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I guess I'll take the last gift. Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It was supposed to be for Meredith, 'cause she said she likes my drawings.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Thanks. I wish I could've had it. Do you wanna trade?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Like anybody would want an oven mitt. [Phyllis gets up and leaves the party]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: So, hey, you wanna trade?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yes, totally, 'cause I was just gonna throw this out anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Really? You were gonna throw out a book?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [Rap music playing] [singing] The time is now, the place is here And the whole wide world is filled with cheer My name's DMC with the mike in my hand And I'm chilling and cooling just like a snow man

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [singing] So open eyes Lend us an ear We wanna say Merry Christmas and Happy New Year [Darryl whooping] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm the DJ because I really know how to heat up a party.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I do enjoy a drink now and again, but tonight, no. I am also an officer of the law and I'm unofficially on the clock. I need to stay sober and alert. Also, on a personal note, I'm not at my best when I drink.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I actually got that for you. I had you originally.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, cool. It looks really interesting. What did you end up with? [Ryan pulls Creed's old coat out of a bag] Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I didn't want anything else, so I figured at least I could give it to a homeless guy.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What did you end up with?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Your shower radio.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You like music at least?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I love it. I actually used to have a radio show back in the '70s.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You're kidding. What was your DJ name?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Whacky-weed Creed.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Turns out that Creed is a pretty interesting guy.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You behaved very badly tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Sorry?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: See, that's what Christmas is all about to me, is when you see someone open a gift and you think, "Man, I wish I got that." I mean, that's just such a great feeling, to watch other people envying a gift that you gave to somebody else. I don't know, it's just... I don't know, just makes you kind of feel good.
